description:
Challenge the tower where death waits with a fist!

You are a novice in martial arts.
By challenging a number of fighters over the tower of death, your fighting skills will be sharpened. The ultimate goal is to defeat the boss awaiting at the summit, and earn the reputation as the strongest fighter.

However, you are still weak when you first visit the tower.
In order to challenge the boss, you have to gain experience while fighting the rival fighters encountered in the middle of the tower.

Boardgame of Death is a card game with deck building as the major mechanism. Through the use of "Combo" which connects different martial arts skills, damage will be given to rival fighters. The game system allows players to acquire martial arts skills by knocking down enemies.

Let's train your fighter to become the strongest one through repeating scenes of victory and defeat.

—user summary
A game in which you can enjoy the tactics of mahjong extremely simply. Exchange your 5 tiles one by one and gain points.
Atnor (means ‘five’ in Eggon Language) is a game of five. Players are imersed in a tactical environment to have a set of five. Perfect for lovers of logic and strategy.

Build your Nigerian home regardless of tribe or religion and be the first to do that if you want to win. The story behind Homia is that Nigeria is a multi-cultural, multi-ethnic and multi-religious country and the player must create a family regardless of the culture or religion. It’s designed to be easy to play. You choose a family and build the family.

Homia is a Memory-style game, where you look at a face down card and try to remember what kind it is. Until you find a homestead tile (also called a "family pad"), you will only memorize where the various tiles are, and put them back face down on the table. Once you finally discover a family pad, you take it into your area. The family pad has various symbols that represent different parts of a household, such as fathers, mothers, sisters, brothers, and pets. The color of the symbol tells you what kind of other cards you will need to complete your family pad. If your family pad has a green symbol, for example, you need to collect one "father" (green background) card to add to your family pad. If there are three yellow symbols on the family pad card, it means he has three daughters, so you'll need to find three of the "daughter" (yellow background) cards to complete your family. If you have a good memory of the cards you looked at before finding your family pad, it will be much easier to find the members of the household required to complete your family pad. Whoever completes their family pad first is the winner!

LUKU-LUKU is an education game with three editions – Noun, Abstract and Map. It’s a fast game and based on the name, it is about how fast your eyes can move. This game tends to make people aware of their surroundings. Lukuluku Map is more of a geographical game while Abstract teaches stars, numbers
and regular shapes in a fun way depending on what the player wants to learn.

It’s a folklore of the Igbo culture meaning Proud Woman. Players compete as
soothsayers to save her from her untimely demise.

Safe Journi chronicles the journey of a traveller on a Nigerian road. Your fellow players use the obstacles encountered in a Nigerian road to prevent you from reaching your destination. Your task is to manoeuvre the obstacles and get to your destination unharmed.

UKUBUWA is a misspelt Swahili word for ‘Greatness’, and it takes you through a journey of young people as you earn and lose wealth. , Ukubuwa is a game that takes you through the four stages of life in your perspective.
It starts with the Learning stage (things that affect you in this stage), then takes you to the Idea stage (Talent Development), the Philanthropy level. The interesting thing is that it brings choice and chance to play – chance because you have to roll dice and play, choice because you have to make decisions. It was designed basically for storytelling. While playing, you gain certain things like how to negotiate, how to spend money. It’s the mechanism. Overall, it’s a game of choice and chance.

It is now 2017, one hundred years since the United States entered the First World War on the side of the Allies in one of the most unnecessary and wasteful wars ever fought.

The research required almost got in the way of the game system, with diagrams and illustrations. Consequently after system, with diagrams and illustrations. Consequently after many rewrites it was decided to create one book as a game system and another as a simple note book. Both over lap each other. It did seem necessary to describe the tactical techniques in some great detail. Fortunately there is plenty of information on how these weapons were used on the battlefield. This availability of information made it possible to transform information into a realistic game system. However incomplete as it may be, the rules still effectively cover only a small part of the late ground war.

The game system includes supportive diagrams, illustrations, tactical notes and Quick Reference Sheets (Q.R.S.). The Turn Sequence and Turn Phases, once understood, make play easy and fast. The system has two Turn Sequences one of which is optional and the other mandatory. Six basic Turn Phases move the game along to a conclusion. Manufacturers will be glad by the fact that the game is best played using lots of figures and models. Let us be glad that there are sources for figures and models.

Basic units are 12 figures for a platoon with four platoons making a company and three to four companies making a battalion. Figures can be mounted individually or on multiple stands. Morale is based on unit size and applicable modifiers. Movement is with a D-10 die roll for both infantry and tanks. Transport and field artillery movement is determined by the roll of a D-6. There are two Turn Phases in which players can shoot. Hand-to-hand combat is easily performed. Players are always encouraged to adjust the rules to suit their perceptions.

To me, Yanks and Tanks captures the flavor of the late war. I hope your games will be hard fought, yet fun, and the game system competes well with other similar systems.

—description from designer

A card game about haemophilia that allows the player to experience what it means to live with this inherited genetic disorder that impairs the body's ability to make blood clots, a process needed to stop bleeding.

This playing game can be played solo or with multiple players. Goal of the game is to score as many points as possible by doing all sorts of activities. More risky activities increase the risk of hemorrhages, which need to be avoided as much as possible.

—description from the designer

Players in turn put a card on top of the center stack. For a play to be allowed, the played card must display either the same color, or the same shape, than the top card of the stack.

If a player can't comply with this rule with any of his cards, he must draw a card. He may then play it immediately, if able, or pass.

The first player without any card in hand is the winner.

—user summary

A science thematic explosive card game, it has a high strategy gameplay. Party with your friends in this "ODD-yssey" space time travel!

In Doxa you take the role of a time traveller scientist and your goal is to win the Nobel Prize. However it is not so easy, you must sabotage the strategies of the other players to troll and take advantage of each situation.
You must build the inventions to obtain the Nobel points and when you reach 10 you win the game.
The game has a low-medium strategy level for being a party game, but dont let this fool you, it will test your ability to make combos and decide the best strategy to benefit yourself or to annoy the other players.

A pinball with a theme of space fight.

The winner is the player who can score the most points with the six white balls. The UFO's at the top of the board, give extra points if you hit them and get them off the ground!

Timeline: ÄŒesko is a card game played using 110 cards. Each card depicts an event on both sides, with the year in which that it occurred on only one side. Players take turns placing a card from their hand in a row on the table. After placing the card, the player reveals the date on it. If the card was placed correctly with the date in chronological order with all other cards on the table, the card stays in place; otherwise the card is removed from play and the player takes another card from the deck.

The first player to get rid of all his cards by placing them correctly wins. If multiple players go out in the same round, then everyone else is eliminated from play and each of those players are dealt one more card for another round of play. If only one player has no cards after a bonus round, he wins; otherwise play continues until a single player goes out.

Timeline: ÄŒesko adds cards with events from Czech Republic and can be combined with any other title in the Timeline series.

Politics can be dirty and politics can be frustrating but now politics can be fun with this fast-paced exciting card game. Players work to win the nomination of their party in the first phase of play then join together in teams to compete in the national election. Votes are gained by using political influence in this trick-taking game. Do you have what it takes to run for office and lead your country to greatness or, at least, have a lot of fun trying?

Run For Office is played in two phases of seven rounds each. The first phase is the Primary where each player works to win the nomination of their own party. The second phase is the Election where players work together in two competing teams to elect a president (winner).

In the Primary, each player gets a party, negotiates a platform by trading cards, and then gains Influence Cards. The Influence Cards are used to win Vote Cards by taking tricks. The Top two players who collect the most votes in their party are the winners of the Primary. The remaining players form teams with the two winners and a final Election takes place. Again, players gain Influence Cards to take Vote Cards through tricks but must do so in teams. The party members with the most votes at the end of the Election are the winners.

-description from designer

Katag: Le jeu de carte is a two players card games.
Each play have is own deck and try to defeat the four other players heroes by playing object cards and action cards.
On his turn, each player is playing one of his four heroes.
Then, according to each hero's action points and object points, a player can give objects and actions from his hand to his engaged Hero.
By comparing attack and defense, one of the hero defeats the other.
First player to defeat the four opposing heroes is the winner.

—user summary

The aim of the game is to be elected President by the majority. This means getting the necessary votes to win more than half of the seats in the National Congress.

In order to get the votes, everything is allowed. Deals with other political parties, buying judges, cheating... but you also need to take into account the other political parties and luck!

You can also choose your lifestyle and what proposals you are going to invest the money from your campaign into. Also you need to decide what you are going to do during your time as President to ensure you win the elections for the following year.

Each turn, players will roll the dice and move their token on the track - either clockwise or counter-clockwise. They then draw a card from a pile corresponding to the colour of the space they landed on. Each colour has its own actions associated with it: Green for political expertise, black for family life, purple for business, gold for bribe and deals.

During the game, several elections are held. During each elections, players invest money - which buys them votes. These translated in positions in congress, which will give back money. There are also special positions, which will give you different advantages. A player wins the game if he manages to get a majority during the elections (50%+1).

Players can negotiate alliances, which allows them to share the benefits of special positions - though it is not possible to win together.

On the berries, get set, go! Who is the fastest hedgehog at the annual hedgehog race? In this original color cube running game, the colorful berries set the pace ... Since it may happen that one or the other berry is lost or stolen by another hedgehog. Squirrel and mouse are waiting for the festive Beerenschmaus at the finish. An exciting race for the berries! For children from 4 years.

Take a thrilling ride through Sacramentos most beautiful and iconic locations, while collaborating to connect them together and with the game.

- A great filler or gateway game that will hit the table often.
- The game can be taught in a few minutes and is highly thematic and accessible.
- Bike route is a light route building game that is semi-cooperative but includes optional rules for more complexity.
- The game has a great climax where eveybody fells like they are 'one turn away from winning.

In the game players build bike routes around the city winning community rewards. The first player to 7 points wins.

The game includes exquisite paintings of local landmarks and locations both past, present and future. This is not the Sacramento of today but a Sacramento of the imagination, with ideas that excite the spirit, from the historical past to the hopeful future. Bike Route includes everything from the majestic Alhambra movie palace to the soon to be completed Powerhouse Science Center on the river. All the wonderful things that you think about when you imagine Sacramento are included. Come play in the Sacramento that never was but will always exist in our hearts.

Bike Route has a long history and has been in development for over 10 years. Originally called Connections the game was never published and looked like it would end up on the pile of great ideas that never were. My daughter AR kept it alive by insisting that we play. "Papa lets play Connections" she would say and we would play. Despite the weak art the game was good and we kept enjoying the drama of the game. Eventually we decided that it should be brought back with new artwork and Bike Route was born. Connections was at heart a game about building connections between places and it seemed a perfect fit for a game about building bike routes. The idea took off and it has kept going ever since.

I was play-testing Bike Route at the main library with a local family and the boy across from me said "We live here..." and pointed at the map. "and I have been to the Zoo." he continued, indicating Land Park at the bottom of the board. Watching him I realized that a lot of kids know places in Sacramento but their mental map doesn't really connect them together. It was great to see the gears turning in his head as he saw all the places in town fit. He also knew DOCO and Old Town and quite a few other places. This was moment of affirmation; I realized that Bike Route could also bring back that great sense of place that is getting lost. Google guides us from place to place without any context or sense of relationship. Yes you can turn left and turn right but where are you?

I travel a lot for work and I am always happy to come home. Ususally I go to a town that is excited about what they are doing but in Sac we have it in spades. It seems that every week brings something new to our doorstep. Mabye a brand new artist or shome classy hippy selling tea. We have to recognize this exciting moment we are living in and celebrate it. Bike Route puts this fantasitc idea down on paper and freezes this instant so we can stop and savor what we have. Take a break from the hustle and bustle and enjoy a great game with family and friends. Recognize how lucky we are and enjoy it.

Bike route is for people who love bikes, games and Sacramento.

Overlap is a card game using small, square cards, each with nine squares that are each colored red, yellow, or blue. The goal of the game is to score points by placing cards such that squares of the same color align. As the name suggests, the cards can overlap one another, adding another level of strategy and requiring spatial-reasoning and critical thinking skills.

How to play:

Set up: Shuffle the deck of cards, then deal each player five cards. Each player places this stack of cards face down in front of them. Place one card from the deck face up in the center of the playing surface.

Gameplay:  Choose a starting player. That player draws the top card from his/her stack and plays it on the playing surface following card placement rules, and then calculates and records his/her score for the turn. Play then continues clockwise. When all players have placed all their cards, the round ends and the cards are shuffled back into the deck. The number of rounds corresponds with the number of players, with each player having an opportunity to go first.

Card placement: Cards may be placed adjacent to other cards in play, but they must be played so that at least one square aligns with a square on an adjacent card. Additionally, they may be played so that the cards partially overlap, as long as the squares align. When cards are played, at least one square must lie over an empty space (you cannot occlude 9 squares with any given card.)

Scoring: When you place a card, any instance in which a square of a certain color lies next to a square of that same color on another card is worth one point. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins!

-description from designer

Storm over Yasuda Auditorium, University of Tokyo is a two-player game of "Yasuda Auditorium Incident", a conflict between Tokyo Metropolitan Police's riot squad and All Campus Joint Struggle League, January 18-19, 1969 during University of Tokyo Protests.

FYI
https://features.japantimes.co.jp/student-riots/

The game system is based on Avalon Hill's Storm Over Arnhem.
Riot Police player aims to remove university students from Yasuda Auditorium (and the surrounding buildings). University Students player aims to block it.

A sequel: University of Tokyo Too Far
Singolo is a chess variant where the player moves like the horse. All 64 fields of the board needs to be touched exactely once.
The players try to move their pieces to the center of the game board. But be careful: The other players should not find out which piece is yours! Therefore, bluffing is an essential part of the game.

The game includes a CD with 33 recorded sounds, such as a church bell, a glass breaking, a car crash, a duck, etc.

Every player gets 5 cards and as soon as the sound from one of his card is played, he must put it down as fast as possible.

Detective Jigsaw Puzzling Game: Purring whitnesses

First, the players read some information about a criminal case. With this information, they start creating a jigsaw puzzle which gives them addtional hints to eventually solve the overall criminal case.

The only whitnesses for the murder of Millicent Manners are her cats.

Detective Jigsaw Puzzling Game: Fatal Diet

First, the players read some information about a criminal case. With this information, they start creating a jigsaw puzzle which gives them addtional hints to eventually solve the overall criminal case.

Claudia Culpepper is killed in an exclusive spa while she wanted to go for a midnight meal...

Detective Jigsaw Puzzling Game: Fatal spending spree

First, the players read some information about a criminal case. With this information, they start creating a jigsaw puzzle which gives them addtional hints to eventually solve the overall criminal case.

A mysterious crime in a shopping mall where 2 men wear the same shirts and one of them is dead now...

Warren Wars is a game about racing to be the first to build your army while your opponents are trying to steal your Carrots and bunnies.

Each player takes turns first drawing a card and then playing a card. Everyone is aiming to be the winner by being the first to fill their Warren with five Recruits or by being the last player standing after wiping out everyone else.

There will be card stealing, taking over other players’ turns, all while trying to maintain their own Warrens.

—description from the publisher
This is an exciting memory game with Mickey and his friends for 2-6 young players.
An exciting dice game for 2-4 young players.
This game is a combination of puzzling and rolling a dice. The player who manages to finish his puzzle at first wins.

Modern War #45, November 2019.

The Dragon and The Hermit Kingdom is a two player game that covers the hypothetical simulation of a second Korean War that could occur in the very near future. This game is a precursor to The Dragon that Engulfed the Sun (Modern War #42). It simulates the war that would have occurred on the Korean peninsula just prior to that game’s setting. The Dragon that Engulfed the Sun assumes that a Chinese victory had already occurred in Korea. This game, however, simulates the entirety of that preceding conflict, beginning with a supposed North Korean invasion of South Korea.

Components: One 22" x 34" map on one sheet & 176 counters.

Modern War #47 March 2020

Objective Nuremberg is the first volume of what will grow to be a series of games, the AFCENT (Allied Forces Central Europe) Series. Each subsequent single-volume game will use the same system and will be playable alone or mated to other games in the series, with the eventual goal being a mega-monster game covering the geographic entirety of this war across the whole East German and Czechoslovakian border areas. Each hexagon on the map represents 2.5 miles (four kilometers) from side to opposite side. The Warsaw Pact regiments, while the units of maneuver on the NATO side are battalions. Air power and electronic warfare are represented abstractly, with counters and rules showing the effects of one side or the other gaining temporary superiority within those sub-realms of conflict. Each day is made up of one nighttime and two daylight turns.

Components: A rules booklet, one 22" x 34" map sheet and 200 one-half inch counters

Card game where players are trying to complete a Royal Flush (A, K, Q, J, 10 all in same suit.

Players are dealt seven cards.  On each turn players first draw from the to of the draw pile or discard pile. Then player discards one card to the discard pile.  If card is an action card then you follow instructions of the card.  As soon as player acquires a Royal Flush (regardless if it is their turn) they take a chip for the suit in which they have a Royal Flush.  Play continues until all chips have been claimed.  Winner is the one with the most chips.

—user summary

Pizza Ninja is the fastest and most honorable way to order pizzas. We guarantee 30 minutes delivery time or our delivery ninja will commit seppuku to regain honor. Order now (Not serving pirates)!

Pizza Ninja is a solitaire game, were you will deliver pizzas to hungry workers in a business building. But beware the pirates that want those pizzas too.

During each of your turns, you can take four actions to move the Ninja around the board and deliver one of your pizzas on random spots on the board. Or you can fight nearby pirates with your Ninja skills. But after you have done your actions, all the pirates will move closer to you and the pizzas and even more pirates will enter the office. If they reach you and hit you, you will loose some of your precious time.

You win, if you can deliver all your pizzas to spots on the board before the time runs out.

The Goblin King is Angry is a Semi Co-Op Game for 2-6 Players in which the players, taking the roles of their unique goblin generals, send Hordes of Goblins at the Human Castle at the center of the board to be the last player to topple it and gain the king's favor.

Taking the Tower Defense genre and turning it on its head, this game is great for those wanting to bring vengeance upon the evil humans that destroy our kind for no reason.

—user summary

DICTADORES is a card game for parties in which you must avoid being punished while getting drunk.
The dictator sets the laws of the game, if someone does not comply, he will be punished.
There are cards that force you to drink and others in which you must play to avoid it.
Each player will have his turn as a dictator, with all the privileges that means.
But beware of coups d'etat.
Do you dare to play it?

The game is played in three decks, the dictator will play with the punishment deck and the law deck, while the rest with the town deck.

A player starts assuming the role of DICTATOR and takes two punishments that he keeps in secret and a law that he puts on his back.

When the first player takes a card from the village deck he must comply with the instructions and this letter, and if it is his turn to drink, he must also comply with the laws.

If the player does not comply with a law, the dictator gives him a punishment.

When the dictator runs out of punishments, it is the turn of another.

In the town deck there are 4 coups. The first three allow the player to end the dictator's turn by removing his punishments. The fourth coup d'etat wins the game, and you can choose any punishment from the deck to give to the current dictator.

—description from the publisher

In Magalhães Bastos, the players will have to save the women who will appear in the neighborhood, solving their problems to win their hearts. Sagacity is necessary to move around the district, since the other players are a constant threat.

On his turn, a player performs three different actions from a menu of twelve. Most actions involve gaining, buying, selling or discarding various items and cards, often on specific board spaces. They also include moving the player's character, threatening (and possibly attacking) an opponent, earning money, hiring a security guard and winning a woman's heart - or stealing it from another player. The game ends after ten rounds or when any player's score goes past 32 points.

—user summary

"Alley Oops! - A Raucous Game of Stumbling and Tumbling for Klutzes!”

Play the raucous game of stumbling and tumbling, Alley Oops! In this traditional American game you roll your colored magic tumbling bean on the ramped game board into a scoring hole. It’s fun and harder than it looks. Classic and addictive fun for the whole family in the original 1930’s retro box. A unique gift for any classic game collector.

The name Alley Oops comes from French Gymnasts, who yell “Allez Hop!” (Let’s Go!) before tumbling on the gym mat.

—description from the publisher

This is a replica of a vintage board game from the 1930s.
A flicking table soccer game.

With shaking hands and a fast-beating heart, you prepare to add another block to the teetering tower. Will it continue to stand, or topple to the ground? A bead of sweat trickles down your forehead as you release the block, and then, the moment of truth. The tower sways for a second, then rights itself. It’s going to stay standing, at least for now. Although most of you are working as a team, one player is a Traitor trying to make the tower fall.

In Crazy Tower, players work together to get rid of their blocks and build a safe, stable structure. All of them, except for one that is. One player takes on the role of the Traitor, looking to deviously make a building that will collapse on another player’s turn. Will they succeed, or will the Tower stand the test of time? Either way, you can bet it’s going to be crazy!

On a turn, players can either place a block on the highest floor of the tower or place a new Floor and then add a block to that floor. A block may only ever be added to the highest Floor and must be laid following the instructions on the Floor. If the team successfully places their final piece on the Tower, they win the game, but if it falls and it’s not on the Saboteur’s turn, then they win.

Encantados is a filler where players assumes the role of a gardener in need to populate his garden with magical creatures. Fairies, leprechauns, gnomes, goblins and Kobolds! Every race has a special ability to help you (or disturb your friend/opposing team). Encantados knows how to balance simplicity with an awesome replay and a lot of fun. Wonderful in every way , whether in its simple mechanics, either in its neat art!

Encantados is played in a series of rounds. Every round, in alternate turns, players buy a new card and have the chance to play one Song and one Set of cards of the same Magical Creature. You can only play creatures if you have three of a kind in your hand. After you play them, they start giving you passive bonus. If one or more players empty their hand the round is over and points are counted. If, by the end of a round, a player score is 100 or higher he is the winner!
—description from the publisher

What changes:
> The 2nd edition is leaner, with blister box instead of the box with a lid, and only cards as components.
> The game comes with only one deck (2 to 4 players), instead of two decks (2 to 6 players). It will still be possible to play up to 6 with two copies of the game - the rules for this variant are in the rules book.
> A new character comes in (the Troll) and an old one comes out (Mandragora, who misses but is remembered fondly in all the cards in the game.
> Powers of the races revised with the aim of making the game more friendly to non-gamers and rebalanced card scores.
> New graphic design and revised manual with minor changes.

The game consists of a deck of 54 cards, each with a single letter and point value on it, as well as several 'Free' cards that can be used as any letter.  The entire deck is dealt out to all players face down.  Players may not look at their deck, but on their turn, flip over the top card and add it to the center of the table.  If they can make a word from the cards in the middle, they take it and score the points on those letters.  Play continues until all cards are used, and the player with the highest score wins.

—user summary

A co-op survival dice game where the players take on the role of Ancestor spirits, who are guiding their living Descendants to the summit of a mountain.  The tribe is making this pilgrimage to remember the Ancestors - and if the Descendants fail in their journey, the Ancestors will be forgotten for all eternity!  The Ancestors must work together to help the tribe survive.  The players win the game together if they manage to bring at least two Descendants to the mountaintop alive.  Any fewer than that, and the players all lose.

The game is played in rounds (5 to 20 max) which represent "days" of travel.  (Increasing duration increases game difficulty.) Each morning, the Shaman of the tribe rolls dice to interpret an Omen: resources that day will be Safe (neutral), Blessed (collect +1), or Cursed.  Taking cursed items will result in additional Danger for the Descendant who disobeyed the Omen!

Randomized terrain cards provide opportunities to forage for various resources - food, medicine, firewood, and crystals for banishing hostile evil spirits.  The Ancestors decide how best to match Descendants' skills to the resources available in any given location.  The more lucrative places also contain the greatest likelihood for danger! A player rolls once for each Descendant who forages during the day.

Each player's role gives them a special power to intervene on behalf of the Descendants.  Some banish evil spirits, heal Descendants, ward off sickness, or other helpful skills.

—description from the designer

ONE PLAYER IS THE KILLER....THE REST ARE VICTIMS

Don't Get Stabbed! is a party card game where you get to kill your family and friends (for pretend).

The killer wins by killing all the victims. The victims win by escaping.

Everyone takes turns drawing cards. If a victim gets three STAB cards, they DIE! But they can use ACTION cards to avoid getting stabbed. And they can use Combo cards for a chance at escaping.

But the killer has special powers. If the killer draws a STAB card, they can put it back in the deck wherever they want. And the killer can use ACTION and Combo cards to thwart the victims’ attempts to stay alive.

—description from the publisher

This game combines Yahtzee and Battle Yahtzee under the movie theme of Disney's Pirate of the Caribbean.  In Battle Yahtzee version, each player starts as one of the captain from the franchise. They receive a card that illustrates the captain and provides a special power (each captain has a different one) to be used during the game.

From the publisher's website: 
Play the classic shake, score & shout dice game or battle it out on the seven seas in this special edition of The Pirates of the Caribbean Yahtzee. Custom playing pieces including dice, game board and ship tokens add a unique twist full of pirate adventure as you roll high scoring dice combinations on the high seas!

The rumor that the Yeti comes around at the Alaska is spreading out. A lot of Hunters hear it and gather for hunting the Yeti at the INN in front of the Snow Mountain.

Right here is the Alaska INN! Players become the hunter and hunt the Yeti for honor. Of course, some of them have no interest in hunting the Yeti and others seek to make benefit through the other ways! Sell the items to hunters, or research about the trace of the Yeti. 
Anyway, this is most interesting case of various cases in West Land recently.

Players stay the Alaska INN during the winter season and expect to see the Yeti. Players place their hunters every rounds for performing the action they want. The capable Actions of players are following: Paying the cost to employ a hunter, Manufacturing the items using their own materials, Selling the own items, Scoring the points by providing the trace and by funding to INN, Going out for hunting (to catch the Yeti or material or the trace and others).

At every round, Environment Card must be open. The Environment Card gives issue to players regarding the trace, change of weather and etc. This game will end when the winter season is over or the Yeti is caught. At this time, a player scoring the highest point will be a winner.

—description from the publisher

Set in New York in the mid 1970s, Borgata challenges players to outwit their opponents, in order to become the most respected member of their family.

A deck building game where players are able to recruit mobsters, purchase weapons, earn income, and bribe public officials  in order to control a handful of businesses and boroughs. Players interact by attacking one another with the cards they have acquired. The goal is to gain respect cards, which are used to move up through the ranks. The game ends when one player does this and successfully becomes a mafia boss.

Borgata is designed to encourage interaction and strategy. Players are often forced to work together in order to prevent a rival player from winning.

—description from the publisher

When it comes to food, lots of people are willing to do anything. And with that bustling market in that food business, you wouldn't miss a chance to pick up the opportunity for your food joint rise up into fame and fortune. That's not all, popularity race is on the take and you need to snatch one of them to boost its fame.

Assign your workers to fetch ingredients to different place in the neighborhood and take orders from your customers. Serve Indonesian authentic food dishes and get various kind of rewards. With calculated planning and right opportunities, your joint might be the next big thing!

Nusa Rasa is a simple worker placement game with resource management, area majority and set collection, that pits players in a competitive business of restaurants serving local authentic dishes from across Indonesia provinces. The game offers 2 distinct modes (family and advance), in which have similar game play but different feel and approach.

Family Mode
Simple worker placement game where players assign workers to get resources they need to serve order cards and get rewards. Players can serve orders any time during their turn without limitation.

Advance Mode
Unlike Family mode, now in Advance more, there are Serving Phase  occurs after each three rounds of the game. Players may only serve orders in this phase and there is penalty if they cannot serve the orders that they had. They also need to pay their workers and resources are discarded after they serve orders. This mode provides experienced players more challenge and planning to consider. The game is designed to be harder than the normal Family mode.

—description from the designer
